m4i_analytics.m4i.portal.DBUtils module¶

class m4i_analytics.m4i.portal.DBUtils.DBUtils[source]¶
static insert_dataset(tablename, if_exists=<InsertBehavior.FAIL: 'fail'>)[source]¶

Insert a dataframe into the given table in the M4I database. You have the option to create a new table if the one specified does not yet exist.

Return type:

None
Parameters:
  • dataframe (DataFrame) – The dataframe containing the records you wish to insert.
  • tablename (str) – The name of the table into which you wish to insert the data.
  • if_exists (InsertBehavior) – Optional. Specifies the behavior when the specified table already exists in the database. Defaults to InsertBehavior.FAIL.
Raises:

ValueError – Thrown when the insert behavior is set to fail and the selected table already exists in the database.
class m4i_analytics.m4i.portal.DBUtils.InsertBehavior[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

APPEND = 'append'¶
FAIL = 'fail'¶
REPLACE = 'replace'¶
class m4i_analytics.m4i.portal.DBUtils.M4I_DB_Connector[source]¶
M4I_DB = Engine(mysql+pymysql://root:***@localhost:3306/superset)¶

m4i_analytics.m4i.portal.PortalApi module¶

class m4i_analytics.m4i.portal.PortalApi.PortalApi[source]¶

This class implements various API calls to functions provided by the M4I portal

static add_project_users(projectid, run_by, users)[source]¶

Give one or more users access to a project

Returns:

The ID of the role assigned to the users
Return type:

int
Parameters:
  • taskid (str) – A unique identifier for the task instance you are starting.
  • projectid (str) – The unique name of the project you wish to update.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
  • users (list) – A list of the users you wish to give access to the project
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static create_project(projectid, run_by, owner_username, owner_email, owner_firstname='John', owner_lastname='Doe')[source]¶

Create a new project on the portal. A project comes with a modelview dashboard by default.

Returns:

The ID of the created dashboard
Return type:

CreateProjectResponse
Parameters:
  • taskid (str) – A unique identifier for the task instance you are starting.
  • projectid (str) – A unique name for the project.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
  • owner_username (str) – The username of the user who will own the project
  • owner_email (str) – The email of the user who will own the project.
  • owner_firstname (str) – Optional. The first name of the user who will own the project. By default, is set to ‘John’.
  • owner_lastname (str) – Optional. The last name of the user who will own the project. By default, is set to ‘Doe’.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters (excluding owner_firstname and owner_lastname) is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static create_table_dashboard(projectid, run_by, tablename)[source]¶

Create a dashboard with a table mirroring a table in the database, based on the given tablename

Returns:

The ID of the created dashboard
Return type:

TableDashboardResponse | str
Parameters:
  • taskid (str) – A unique identifier for the task instance you are starting.
  • projectid (str) – The unique name of the project you wish to update.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
  • tablename (str) – The name of the table in the database you wish to mirror on the dashboard
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static remove_project_user(projectid, run_by, username)[source]¶

Remove access to a project for a particular user

Returns:

A string signaling that the operation completed successfully (‘OK’)
Return type:

str
Parameters:
  • taskid (str) – A unique identifier for the task instance you are starting.
  • projectid (str) – The unique name of the project you wish to update.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
  • username (str) – The username of the user for whom you wish to revoke access
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static unpublish_project(projectid, run_by)[source]¶

Remove access to a project for all current members

Returns:

A string signaling that the operation completed successfully (‘OK’)
Return type:

str
Parameters:
  • taskid (str) – A unique identifier for the task instance you are starting.
  • projectid (str) – The unique name of the project you wish to update.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static update_project(projectid, run_by, branch_name, model_timestamp, data_timestamp, parser_name='archimate3')[source]¶

Update the model and data associated with a project in a single call.

Returns:

A string signaling that the operation completed successfully (‘OK’)
Return type:

str
Parameters:
  • taskid (str) – A unique identifier for the task instance you are starting.
  • projectid (str) – The unique name of the project you wish to update.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
  • branch_name (str) – The name of the branch of the model you wish to use as the source of the update.
  • model_timestamp (long) – The version of the model you wish to use as the source of the update.
  • data_timestamp (long) – The version of the data you wish to use as the source of the update.
  • parser_name (str) – Optional. The name of the meta-model of the model you wish to use as the source of the update. Currently, the only valid option is ‘archimate3’. Defaults to ‘archimate3’.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static update_project_data(projectid, run_by, branch_name, version, parser_name='archimate3')[source]¶

Update the data associated with a project.

Returns:

A string signaling that the operation completed successfully (‘OK’)
Return type:

str
Parameters:
  • taskid (str) – A unique identifier for the task instance you are starting.
  • projectid (str) – The unique name of the project you wish to update.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
  • branch_name (str) – The name of the branch of the model you wish to use as the source of the update.
  • version (long) – The version of the data you wish to use as the source of the update.
  • parser_name (str) – Optional. The name of the meta-model of the model you wish to use as the source of the update. Currently, the only valid option is ‘archimate3’. Defaults to ‘archimate3’.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.

Returns:

A string signaling that the operation completed successfully (‘OK’)
Return type:

str

  • projectid (str) – The unique name of the project you wish to update.
  • run_by (str) – A unique identifier for the user who started the operation.
  • branch_name (str) – The name of the branch of the model you wish to use as the source of the update.
  • version (long) – The version of the model you wish to use as the source of the update.
